channel.title: Making a model 3d In Metasequoia
channel.description:
[size=50pt]Reply or i will remove.[/size] Ok here is my TuT on making a model 3d:)
First make a model base*NOT LIKE THIS:P* [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_22Dec022323.jpg[/img]
Then go to "Edit" then click "Select All" or hit Ctrl+A. [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_19Dec022315.jpg[/img]
Go to "Selected" then "Copy" now you copyed the model:P [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_20Dec022317.jpg[/img]
Go to "Selected then " Paste" [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_21Dec022318.jpg[/img]
Then Go to Move: [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_23Dec022332.jpg[/img]
Then It will look like this: [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_24Dec022334.jpg[/img]
Simply move your Model's second layer to the right spot:NOTE: i moved it to far away from the base:P [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_24Dec022334.jpg[/img]
Without Points: [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_26Dec022339.jpg[/img]
Then go to "Create" : [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_29Dec022348.jpg[/img]
Then your Create Face Panel should pop-up and click on this: [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_30Dec022349.jpg[/img]
Click On Face & Front: [IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_31Dec022350.jpg[/img]
Then keep clicking onto your Points Until it's all filled up^^
End Result would look something like this*Coloured mine:P*[IMG]http://i349.photobucket.com/albums/q387/floris1994/ScreenHunter_32Dec022359.jpg[/img]
Well that was my TuT;) If i forgot something please post it Don't Flame stuff like FAIL ;) Hope i Helped^^

item.title: Making a model 3d In Metasequoia
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“MrPotatoHead, post:15, topic:248283”]Nice simple tut

Dylan your wrong - use triangulate faces.
reduce polygons will ALWAYS delete at least 1 vertex, try it with a cube from the primitives.

Datmaker will load quads, it’s tell you the models got quads and needs remodelling, it then ignores the 4th vertex and puts holes in your model. Well it did warn you :P[/quote]Ty dude:]
but i got a frikkin’ problem with the new DatMaker=\ it still doesn’t works lol and i get no background , the background stays black.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 07, 2009, 03:07:16 am[/size][hr][quote=“rockh4rd, post:14, topic:248283”]ok
ive drawn my sword
and made it 3d

how do i colour it in??

please help me

-rockh4rd[/quote]if you read my tut… it should explain how lol=P
but OK because its you… my biach…
ill explain again lol.
First!:
go to “Create”

Then Pick This:

Then make a new colour or pick the colour that you already made/picked in your mat-panel.
and click on the points of your sword to fill it in with colours!

Read full topic

item.title: Making a model 3d In Metasequoia
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Nice simple tut

Dylan your wrong - use triangulate faces.
reduce polygons will ALWAYS delete at least 1 vertex, try it with a cube from the primitives.

Datmaker will load quads, it’s tell you the models got quads and needs remodelling, it then ignores the 4th vertex and puts holes in your model. Well it did warn you

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789

@dylan_0789 wrote:

CJ, im not wrong. i always use “Reduce Polygons”. its SO easy and u DONT set it to low u leave it. it works perfectly for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a model 3d In Metasequoia
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

dylan_0789:

its easy to fix the quads afterwords. i make my models all in quads. all u do is go Object>Reduce Polyhons.

Man, you keep tellin everyone this, and you’re wrong.
You have to take it out of basic mode, by clicking on file, then untick “Basic mode”, then select all, go to selected, and go to triangulate, this triangulates all faces that are not triangles, like squares etc.

Whereas if you use reduce polygons, it sometimes can delete some parts, especially if you set the poly count relatively low.

On topic: Nice, i hope some people will be able to understand linksys’ tut a little better now.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a model 3d In Metasequoia
item.dc:creator: @pluh1 pluh1
item.description:
@pluh1 wrote:

You don’t choose faces, you choose tri for triangles. If you do faces, you will make quadrilaterals, and you’ll get an error about “contains quads - lines” in DatMaker, so some of the faces will be transparent. It’ll basically screw up your model. But if you already did it with quads, you can go to the Selected tab at the top, and click “Triangulate Selected Faces”. This will fix the quads. Make sure you fix the picture, AC Fan.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a model 3d In Metasequoia

item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[size=50pt]Reply or i will remove.[/size]
Ok here is my TuT on making a model 3d:)

First make a model baseNOT LIKE THIS:P

Then go to “Edit” then click “Select All” or hit Ctrl+A.

Go to “Selected” then “Copy” now you copyed the model:P

Go to “Selected then " Paste”

Then Go to Move:

Then It will look like this:

Simply move your Model’s second layer to the right spot:NOTE: i moved it to far away from the base:P

Without Points:

Then go to “Create” :

Then your Create Face Panel should pop-up and click on this:

Click On Face & Front:

Then keep clicking onto your Points Until it’s all filled up^^

End Result would look something like thisColoured mine:P

Well that was my TuT;)
If i forgot something please post it
Don’t Flame stuff like FAIL
Hope i Helped^^
